questions_and_notes: The description is clearly wrong (downwelling LW is 0).  It is not clear whether this is the *difference* in radiation when the volcanic aerosols are removed or are added or whether it is the actual result of the second radiation call, but with aerosols removed (or added?). This should have a standard name like the ones proposed above. Consider using the term "forcing" as in some variables above.  Also, not clear why 6-hour sampling is appropriate for this variable (doesn't resolve diurnal cycle, so why not daily?)  And why is all-sky not requested (also or instead)?
specific_issues: 8:Deprecate? Only 3 groups contributed this variable in CMIP6.
long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
comment: downwelling longwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call
